member.summary: Represents the possible conditions under which the Value of a should be refreshed.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.Serialization.RichTextRefreshTrigger.Explicit
member.summary: The Value will never be refreshed automatically. The consumer must call on the adapter to update the Value.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.Serialization.RichTextRefreshTrigger.Delayed
member.summary: The and/or intervals can be set to non-null values to indicate a delay after certain edits when the Value should be refreshed. If neither is set, this trigger will act like the Explicit trigger.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.Serialization.RichTextRefreshTrigger.ContentChanged
member.summary: The Value is refreshed after every edit by the user. Note: This trigger could cause a performance issue with large documents. It should therefore only be used in editors which will only contain a small amount of text.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.Serialization.RichTextRefreshTrigger.LostFocus
member.summary: The Value is refreshed after the user leaves the editor hosting the . If the document isn't displayed in an editor, this trigger will act like the Explicit trigger.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.Serialization.RichTextDocumentAdapterBase.DelayAfterFirstEditProperty
member.summary: Identifies the dependency property

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.Serialization.RichTextDocumentAdapterBase.DelayAfterFirstEdit
member.summary: Returns or sets the interval after the first edit of the when the Value should be refreshed.

remarks.p: This interval is only used when the is set to Delayed.
The first edit is defined as the first edit after the document is displayed or the first edit after the previous refresh of the Value property.
This delay can be used in conjunction with . The first delay which elapses will cause the Value to be refreshed.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.Serialization.RichTextDocumentAdapterBase.DelayAfterLastEditProperty
member.summary: Identifies the dependency property

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.Serialization.RichTextDocumentAdapterBase.DelayAfterLastEdit
member.summary: Returns or sets the interval after the last edit of the when the Value should be refreshed.

remarks.p: This interval is only used when the is set to Delayed.

The last edit is the most recent edit by user. If this delay has not yet elapsed and another edit is made by the user, the timer will reset and the full interval will need to elapse again before the Value is refreshed.
This delay can be used in conjunction with . The first delay which elapses will cause the Value to be refreshed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.Serialization.SaveToClipboardContext.SelectedContentRootNode
member.summary: Gets the root node of the temporary tree representing all selected content from the document.

remarks.p: If the entire document is selected, this will not be a temporary tree's root node. It will be the original document's root node.

Note: regardless of whether this root node is that of a temporary tree or the original document, nodes within it should not be modified as it is shared among all serializers saving content to the clipboard.

member.summary: Initializes a new

member.name: E:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.RichTextDocument.ContentChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the content in the document is changed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.RichTextDocument.DefaultAvailableStyles
member.summary: A static collection of styles used to pre-populate each 's collection.

remarks.para: Note: This collection is used in the RichTextDocument's constructor to pre-populate its collection with clones of all the styles from this collection. Both this static DefaultAvailableStyles collection as well as the instance AvailableStyles collection can be modified. However, changes to the static collection will have no effect on the AvailableStyles collection for existing RichTextDocuments.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.RichTextDocument.AggregateOffsetCount
member.summary: Gets the total length of the document, which includes all the text as well as offsets that are assigned to other content such as paragraphs, list items, images etc...

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.RichTextDocument.AvailableStyles
member.summary: A collection of the styles that are available to the document.

remarks.para: Note: This collection is created in the RichTextDocument's constructor. It is pre-populated with clones of all the styles in the static collection. Both the static DefaultAvailableStyles collection as well as this instance AvailableStyles collection can be modified. However, changes to the static collection will have no effect on the AvailableStyles collection for existing RichTextDocuments.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.RichTextDocument.CurrentVersion
member.summary: Gets the instance representing the current version of the document.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.RichTextDocument.IsReadOnly
member.summary: Returns/sets whether or not the text in the document can be changed.
member.value: False if the text can be edited, otherwise true.

remarks.para: IsReadOnly property is used by the RichTextEditor to prevent the end user from making any modifications to the document.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.RichTextDocument.RootNode
member.summary: Gets the document root node.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.RichTextDocument.UndoManager
member.summary: Returns/sets the object that manages the undo/redo stacks

remarks.para: Note: by default each instance of a RichTextDocument will instantiate its own . However, since this property is settable it is possible to have some or all TextDocuments share a single UndoManager.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.RichTextDocument.UnsupportedContentHandlingMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the value indicating how to handle known unsupported content when portions of it can be loaded.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.RichTextDocument.UnsupportedContentHighlightSettings
member.summary: Gets or sets the character settings to use when highlighting portions of unsupported content which could be loaded.

remarks.p: These settings will be used when is either IncludeAndHighlightContent or IncludeMessage. If they are not specified, a default set of highlight settings will be used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.RichTextDocument.UnsupportedContentMessage
member.summary: Gets or sets the message to use when displaying a message in place of known unsupported content.

remarks.p: This message will be used when is IncludeMessage. If it is not specified, a default message will be used.

If an error occurs, this will be set to an error message.
If true then a new paragraph is created.

Optional parameter. Character settings to apply to the text. If null and is true then the inserted text will pick up the settings of the paragraph content before the specified offset. If non-null and is true then settings from this settings object will be merged with the settings from the previous content and the merged settings will be applied to the inserted text. If is false then these settings will be applied as they are without merging, even in the case where characterSettings is null in which case any explicit settings from the previous content will not be applied to the new content.
Optional parameter. Run style to apply to the text. If null and is true then the inserted text will pick up the style of the paragraph content before the specified offset.
Indicates whether to use any explicit character settings and run style from the paragraph content before the specified offset.

member.param: Document span to apply the changes to.
object that contains the settings to apply. Only properties of the object with non-null values will be applied.
If an error occurs, this will be set to an error message.

remarks.para: ApplyCharacterSettings method applies settings across multiple runs that are contained by the specified span. If a run partially spans the specified document span then the run will be broken up as necessary so that only the content that's contained by the span is applied the specified settings.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.RichTextDocument.ApplyCharacterStyle(Infragistics.Documents.RichText.DocumentSpan,System.String,System.String@,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Applies specified character style to runs in the specified span.
member.param: Document span to apply the changes to.
Id of a character style in the root node's collection or collection of the document. In the latter case the style will be copied from the available styles into the root node's styles collection.
If a character style with the specified id doesn't exist or if any other error occurs, this will be set to the error message.

Specifies whether to clear runs' explicit . If a run has had some formatting applied to it previously then its Settings would have been set accordingly. A run's Settings property takes precedence over the style settings. Therefore passing in True for this parameter will ensure the settings from the specified style don't get overridden by RunNode's Settings.

remarks.para: ApplyCharacterStyle method sets the property of runs that are contained by the specified span. If a run partially spans the specified document span then the run will be broken up as necessary so that only the content that's contained by the span is applied the specified character style.
Note that if any run in the span has a style id previously set, that will be reset to the specified .

member.summary: Applies the specified list style to paragraphs intersecting the specified , in effect making the paragraphs into a bulleted or numbered list according to the list style referred to by the specified .
member.param: Paragraphs intersecting this span will be affected.

Id of a in DocumentRootNode's collection. If a list style with this id doesn't exist in the styles collection then it's searched in the collection and if one is found then it's moved into the DocumentRootNode's Styles collection. Otherwise an is set and this method takes no action.
If an error occurs, this parameter will be set to the error message.

remarks.para: If one or more paragraphs are already part of a list, they will be removed from that list and made into a separate list using the specified list style. If the list style however matches the existing list style of such paragraphs, then the paragraphs will remain in their current list without any modification.

member.summary: Removes all the Undo and Redo history that relates to this RichTextDocument.
member.param: Indicates whether this method should affect the current open RootTransaction on the if there is one.

remarks.para: Note: this is equivalent to calling the 's RemoveAll method with a filter that removes only undo units whose Target is this RichTextDocument. By default that will be all of the history, however, since the property is settable it is possible to share a single instance of an UndoManager with more that one RichTextDocument so that there histories are mingled.

member.summary: Enumerates the available Character styles
member.param: True to include styles that marked hidden.
On optional filter callback to restrict the returned styles
member.returns: An enumerable for the available character styles.

remarks.para: Note: the first styles returned will be the ones that are already in the RootNode's Styles collection. These styles will be passed into the optional filter with a second parameter of true. Following these styles will by any additional unused styles in the collection (with the second filter parameter set to false). Returning true from the filter will cause the style to be included in the returned enumerable, returning false will exclude the style. If no filter is supplied then all styles will be returned.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.RichTextDocument.GetCommonCharacterSettings(Infragistics.Documents.RichText.DocumentSpan,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets the common character settings across the runs in the specified span.
member.param: Document span. If empty then returns the settings of the previous character in the paragraph that contains the span's offset. If there's no previous character then returns the settings of the next character in the paragraph. If the paragraph is empty then returns the paragraph's resolved character settings.
Indicates whether to ignore leading and trailing whitespace around the text contained in the specified span.

remarks.para: This method gets common character settings of text contained in the specified span. As an example, if all the text in the span is bold then the returned settings will have set to true as well. If all of the text is not bold then the Bold will be set false. However if some text in the span is bold and some is not then the returned settings will have Bold set to null.

member.returns: CharacterSettings object that has common settings from the text in the specified span.

member.summary: Gets the id of the list style used by paragraphs intersecting the specified span.
member.param: Document span object.
member.returns: If all the paragraphs intersecting the specified span all are list paragraphs that utilize the same instance, then the id of that list style is returned. If one or more paragraphs are not list paragraphs or utilize different list styles then this method returns null.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.RichTextDocument.GetCommonParagraphSettings(Infragistics.Documents.RichText.DocumentSpan)
member.summary: Gets the common paragraph settings across paragraphs that intersect the specified span.
member.param: Document span. If empty then gets the settings of the paragraph that contains the span's offset.

remarks.para: This method gets common paragraph settings of all the paragraphs that intersect the specified span. As an example, if all intersecting paragraphs have their resolved as Center then the returned ParagraphSettings will have that property set to that value. If one or more paragraphs among the intersecting paragraphs have different alignment setting then the returned settings object will have ParagraphAlignment set to null.

member.returns: CharacterSettings object that has common settings from the text in the specified span.

member.summary: Indents the (bulleted or numbered list) associated with the paragraph at the specified . If the paragraph at the 'documentOffset' is not part of a list then this method does nothing.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.RichTextDocument.IndentParagraphs(Infragistics.Documents.RichText.DocumentSpan,System.Nullable{Infragistics.Documents.RichText.Extent},System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Adds to the existing indentation of paragraphs intersecting the specified document span by the specified amount. If paragraphs are part of a list then changes their list levels instead.
member.param: Paragraphs intersecting this document span are affected.

Amount by which to increase indentation of paragraphs. If null then indents to the next tab stop. Note that if the paragraphs are part of a list then this value is ignored and instead paragraphs' list level values are increased.

If true then indents only the first line. If false then indents the whole paragraph. If null then it enulates the user interface behavior of indenting either the first line or the paragraph depending on the value of the intersectSpan where if it's a zero length span with the start value that points to the beginning of the paragraph then it will indent the first line, otherwise the whole paragraph.
member.returns: True if operation indented or outdented one or more paragraphs. False if operation was a NOOP which can be when the paragraph's current indentation is at a point where it cannot be indented/outdented.

Indicates whether to emulate user interface behavior inside an editor when the enter key is pressed to insert a new paragraph. For example, when the corresponds to end of a table row (row mark) then a new row is added to the table instead of a new paragraph.

remarks.para: InsertParagraph method inserts a new paragraph at the specified document offset. It emulates the behavior of hitting Enter key inside a paragraph in the document. If the offset is inside an existing paragraph then the paragraph is split into two where the content inside the existing paragraph after the offset ends up being part of the new paragraph.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.RichTextDocument.InsertText(System.Int32,System.String,System.String@,Infragistics.Documents.RichText.CharacterSettings,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Inserts the specified text in the document at the specified document offset. If the document offset refers to a block node, it finds an appropriate text node inside the block node to add the text to. If a text node is not found, it will add one to ensure the text gets inserted at a location that would be considered 'intended' within the block node.
member.param: Document offset at which to insert the text.
Text to be inserted. If text is null or empty then this method does nothing.
If there's an error, this out parameter is set to the error information.

Optional parameter. Character settings to apply to the text. If null and is true then the inserted text will pick up the settings of the paragraph content before (or after if no paragraph content before) the specified offset. If non-null and is true then settings from this settings object will be merged with the settings from the previous content and the merged settings will be applied to the inserted text. If is false then these settings will be applied as they are without merging, even in the case where characterSettings is null in which case any explicit settings from the previous content will not be applied to the new content.
Optional parameter. Run style to apply to the text. If null and is true then the inserted text will pick up the style of the paragraph content before the specified offset.
Indicates whether to use any explicit character settings and run style from the paragraph content before (or after if no paragraph content before) the specified offset.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.RichTextDocument.OutdentList(System.Int32,System.Nullable{Infragistics.Documents.RichText.Extent})
member.summary: Outdents the (bulleted or numbered list) associated with the paragraph at the specified . If the paragraph at the 'documentOffset' is not part of a list then this method does nothing.
member.param: List associated with the paragraph at this document offset is modified.
A positive amount by which to outdent. If null then outdents by a default amount.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.RichTextDocument.OutdentParagraphs(Infragistics.Documents.RichText.DocumentSpan,System.Nullable{Infragistics.Documents.RichText.Extent},System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Substracts from the existing indentation of paragraphs intersecting the specified document span by the specified amount. If paragraphs are part of a list then changes their list levels instead.
member.param: Paragraphs intersecting this document span are affected.

Amount by which to decrease indentation of paragraphs. If null then outdents to previous tab stop. Note that if the paragraphs are part of a list then this value is ignored and instead paragraphs' list level values are increased.

If true then outdents only the first line. If false then outdents the whole paragraph. If null then it enulates the user interface behavior of outdenting either the first line or the paragraph depending on the value of the intersectSpan where if it's a zero length span with the start value that points to the beginning of the paragraph then it will outdent the first line, otherwise the whole paragraph.
member.returns: True if operation indented or outdented one or more paragraphs. False if operation was a NOOP which can be when the paragraph's current indentation is at a point where it cannot be indented/outdented.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.RichTextDocument.RetainCurrentClipboardData
member.summary: If the current data on the Clipboard was placed there by a in the current AppDomain, this method will ensure the data stays on the Clipboard so it can still be pasted to external applications even if the application is closing.
member.returns: True if a RichTextDocument has performed the most recent Cut or Copy operation on the system and the data was retained; False otherwise.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.RichTextDocument.StopUndoLogging
member.summary: Stops undo logging. Note that existing undo/redo history of the document will be cleared.

remarks.para: StopUndoLogging method stops undo logging. Any existing undo/redo history of the document is cleared by this method. Also calling this method again without intervening takes no action and only a single call to StartUndoLogging method is required to restart undo logging.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.RichTextDocument.ToggleCharacterFormatting(Infragistics.Documents.RichText.DocumentSpan,Infragistics.Documents.RichText.CharacterFormatType)
member.summary: Toggles specified character formatting on the text contained in the specified span.
member.param: Document span to apply the change to.
Character format to toggle.

remarks.para: If all the text in the specified span currently has the specified format then the format will be removed. If none of the text has the format then all the text will have the format applied to it. If only some of the text has the format currently applied then the format will be removed from any such text and all the text in the span will end up without the format.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.RichTextDocument.AddParagraphIfDocumentEmpty
member.summary: If the document doesn't have any content, it adds a paragraph and if necessary the root and body nodes as well.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.RichTextDocument.AdjustDocumentOffsetForInput(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the document offset where the content will actually be inserted if API's to insert content is called with the specified document offset.
member.param: Document offset.
member.returns: Adjusted document offset or the same value as the if no adjustment is necessary.

remarks.para: Entering text or content at certain locations in the document is not valid, such as right before the row mark, since the row itself doesn't hold any content and all the content belonging to a row needs to be in one of its cells. In such a case, the user interface that allows the end user to insert content or type text should automatically adjust the caret position to a nearby valid document location where the content can be inserted (in example above to the next cell or the paragraph following the last row). This method is used to calculate the valid document offset where such a user interface can adjust the caret position to before entering content.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.RichTextDocument.MergeListInfosHelper(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Infragistics.Documents.RichText.RichTextList})
member.summary: Merges the list infos from the source into the list infos collection of the root node. If an existing list info has the same id as one from the source then if the list info is not being used by any content in the document then it's replaced with the one from the source. If there's content in the document using that list info then it's left as is and the list info from the source is not copied over.

member.summary: Merges the styles from the source into the styles collection of the root node. If an existing style has the same id as one from the source then if the style is not being used by any content in the document then it's replaced with the one from the source. If there's content in the document using that style then it's left as is and the style from the source is not copied over.
member.param: Source collection from which to copy styles.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.RichTextStyleCollection
member.summary: Represents a collection of styles which can be applied to contents in the document.

remarks.para: Content within a document, such as a paragraph, can have styling applied to it via settings properties exposed by the node representing the content (such as ). You can also define document wide styles which then can be applied to one or more content nodes in the document via the node's style id property (for example, ). RichTextStyleCollection exposed via let's you specify one or more such styles. Each style added to the RichTextStyleCollection is associated with a unique id (a string value specified via property) that is used to associate the style with a node via the node's StyleId property.

member.summary: Adds a tab to the collection.
member.param: The position of the tab.
The alignment of text with respect to the tab's position
The character that leads the tab stop.

remarks.para: Note: all tab stops in the collection are ordered via their ascending positions. When a new tab stop is added it is automatically slotted appropriately. If another tab stop was already at that position, the old tab stop is replaced by the one that was added. Therefore, there can never be 2 tab stops with the same position in the collection.

member.exception: if collection is read only.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.CharacterEmphasisMark
member.summary: Specified an emphasis mark placed on characters

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.CharacterEmphasisMark.None
member.summary: No emphasis mark will be drawn.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.CharacterEmphasisMark.Dot
member.summary: Specifies that the emphasis mark is a dot character which shall be rendered above each character in this run using Unicode character 0x02D9 whenever the language of the text is not Japanese, Simplified Chinese, or Traditional Chinese. For those three languages, the emphasis mark shall be rendered as follows: -> Japanese = Unicode character 0xFF0E (dot beneath characters) -> Simplified Chinese = Unicode character 0xFF0E (dot beneath characters) -> Traditional Chinese = Unicode character 0x2027

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.CharacterEmphasisMark.Comma
member.summary: Specifies that the emphasis mark is a comma character which will be rendered above each character in this run, using Unicode character 0x3001.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.CharacterEmphasisMark.Circle
member.summary: a circle character whichis rendered above each character in the run using Unicode character 0x02DA when the language of the text is not Traditional Chinese. For that language Unicode character 0x3002 wil be used instead, positioned beneath the characters.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.CharacterEmphasisMark.UnderDot
member.summary: Specifies that the emphasis mark is a dot character which shall be rendered below each character in this run using Unicode character 0xFF0E.

member.summary: Specifies that the extent will be at least the value specified, but can be expanded as needed.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.ExtentRule.Exact
member.summary: Specifies that extent will be exactly the value specified regardless of the contents, if the contents are too large they will be clipped.

member.summary: Text should be oriented vertically and flow from right to left as new lines are needed.

member.summary: Determines how a paragraph numbers will be aligned.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.NumberAlignment.Start
member.summary: Specifies that each paragraph number's left edge will be aligned at the indent specified for that level, i.e. the number will start at the indent and take up space to the right of the indent.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.NumberAlignment.Center
member.summary: Specifies that each paragraph number will be centered at the indent specified for that level.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.NumberAlignment.End
member.summary: Specifies that each paragraph number's right edge will be aligned at the indent specified for that level, i.e. the number will start to the left of the indent and run up to the indent.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.OffsetTrackingMode
member.summary: Determines how s track between versions.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.OffsetTrackingMode.Positive
member.summary: The offset tracks toward the end of the document. An insertion at the current position pushes the offset to the end of the inserted text. If a replacement contains the offset, it will end up at the end of the replacement text.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.OffsetTrackingMode.Negative
member.summary: The offset tracks toward the beginning of the document. An insertion at the current position leaves the offset unchanged. If a replacement contains the offset, it will end up at the beginning of the replacement text.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.SpanTrackingMode
member.summary: Determines how s track between versions.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.SpanTrackingMode.EdgeExclusive
member.summary: The leading edge uses a positive tracking mode and the trailing edge uses a negative tracking mode. This causes the span to not expand when text is inserted at either boundary.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.SpanTrackingMode.EdgeInclusive
member.summary: The leading edge uses a negative tracking mode and the trailing edge uses a positive tracking mode. This causes the span to expand when text is inserted at either boundary.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.SpanTrackingMode.EdgePositive
member.summary: Both edges of the span use a positive tracking mode.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.SpanTrackingMode.EdgeNegative
member.summary: Both edges of the span use a negative tracking mode.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.TabStopAlignment

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.TabStopAlignment.Start
member.summary: Text will have its left edge aligned with this tab stop

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.TabStopAlignment.Bar
member.summary: Specifies that the tab is a bar tab. A bar tab is a tab which does not result in a custom tab stop (this tab stop location shall be skipped when positioning custom tab characters), but instead shall be used to draw a vertical line (or bar) at this location in the parent paragraph

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.TabStopAlignment.Center
member.summary: Text will have its center aligned with this tab stop

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.TabStopAlignment.Clear
member.summary: Specifies that the tab stop is cleared (i.e. ignored)

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.TabStopAlignment.Decimal
member.summary: The decimal point of a number will be aligned with this tab stop

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.TabStopAlignment.End
member.summary: Text will have its right edge aligned with this tab stop

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.TabStopLeader
member.summary: Determines what characters will lead the tab.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.TabStopLeader.None
member.summary: Specifies that there will be no leader for this tab stop.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.TabStopLeader.Dot
member.summary: Specifies that the leader character for this tab stop will be a '.'.

member.summary: Specifies that the leader character for this tab stop will be a '-'.

member.summary: Specifies that the leader character for this tab stop will be a vertically centered '.'.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.TabStopLeader.Underscore

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.TableAreaSettingsUsageFlags
member.summary: Identifies which table area settings to use for a table

remarks.para: Note: the 4 areas that related to the corner cells of the table, TopLeftCell, TopRightCell. BottomLeftCell and BottomRightCell, will only be used if their intersecting Row and Column TableAreaSettingsUsageFlags are specified. For example, the BottomLeftCell area will be ignored unless both FirstColumn and LastRow TableAreaSettingsUsageFlags are set.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.TableAreaSettingsUsageFlags.FirstColumn
member.summary: The first column of cells in a table.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.TableAreaSettingsUsageFlags.FirstRow
member.summary: The first row of cells in a table.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.TableAreaSettingsUsageFlags.LastColumn
member.summary: The last column of cells in a table.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.TableAreaSettingsUsageFlags.LastRow
member.summary: The last row of cells in a table.

member.summary: Horizontal (i.e. Row) banding

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.TableAreaSettingsUsageFlags.VerticalBanding
member.summary: Vertical (i.e. Column) banding

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.TableAreaSettingsUsageFlags.AllAreasWithoutBanding
member.summary: Use settings for all areas except for banding related areas

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.TableAreaSettingsUsageFlags.AllAreas
member.summary: Use settings for all areas including banding related areas

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.TableCellBorderResolutionFlags
member.summary: Represents the various resolution options which can be used for table cell borders.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.TableCellBorderResolutionFlags.None
member.summary: Use the default resolution for all table cell borders.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.TableCellBorderResolutionFlags.IgnoreTableAreaCellSettingsForStart
member.summary: For the Start border of the cell, the applicable table area cell settings should be ignored when resolving the border. Instead, the owning table's resolved InsideVertical border should be used.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.TableCellBorderResolutionFlags.IgnoreTableAreaCellSettingsForTop
member.summary: For the Top border of the cell, the applicable table area cell settings should be ignored when resolving the border. Instead, the owning table's resolved InsideHorizontal border should be used.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.TableCellBorderResolutionFlags.IgnoreTableAreaCellSettingsForEnd
member.summary: For the End border of the cell, the applicable table area cell settings should be ignored when resolving the border. Instead, the owning table's resolved InsideVertical border should be used.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.TableCellBorderResolutionFlags.IgnoreTableAreaCellSettingsForBottom
member.summary: For the Bottom border of the cell, the applicable table area cell settings should be ignored when resolving the border. Instead, the owning table's resolved InsideHorizontal border should be used.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.TableCellBorderResolutionFlags.IgnoreTableAreaCellSettingsForAllEdges
member.summary: For the Start, Top, End, and Bottom borders of the cell, the applicable table area cell settings should be ignored when resolving the borders. Instead, the owning table's resolved InsideVertical and InsideHorizontal borders should be used.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.Extent
member.summary: Represents a extent value

remarks.para:
Note: a type converter is supplied to allow this structure to be specified in xaml. Here are some sample values, in quotes, along with corresponding c# code examples :
"5" - new Extent(5, ExtentUnitType.Points)
"5.5pt" - new Extent(5.5, ExtentUnitType.Points)
"5pc" - new Extent(60, ExtentUnitType.Points)
"105twip" - new Extent(105, ExtentUnitType.Twips)
".23in" - new Extent(.23, ExtentUnitType.Inches)
".23cm" - new Extent(.23, ExtentUnitType.Centimeters)
".23mm" - new Extent(.23, ExtentUnitType.Millimeters)
"17px" - new Extent(17, ExtentUnitType.LogicalPixels)
"200emu" - new Extent(200, ExtentUnitType.Emus)

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.TableCellNode.ClearContent
member.summary: Clears the cell content.

remarks.para: ClearContent method clears the content of the cell. If the cell has multiple paragraphs it removes all but the last paragraph and clears the contents of the last paragraph. This is to retain at least one paragraph in the cell which is necessary in order to allow the caret to be positioned inside the cell to allow for further input via UI.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.TableCellNode.GetText(Infragistics.Documents.RichText.PlainTextFormatOptions)
member.summary: Gets the text in the paragraph.
member.returns: A string value that represents text in the paragraph.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.TableCellNode.SetText(System.String)
member.summary: Changes the text of the cell to be the specified text.
member.param: New text of the cell.

remarks.para: SetText method removes existing content of the cell and sets the specified text as the new content of the cell. If the cell has multiple paragraphs then all but the last paragraph will be removed and the last paragraph's content will be set to the specified text. If the cell doesn't have any paragraphs then a new paragraph will be added to it.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.DocumentBodyNode
member.summary: Represents the document body, which contains paragraphs, tables and other document content.

remarks.para: A has a single root node of type, specified via the property. DocumentRootNode contains a one and only one instance of DocumentBodyNode, which represents the document's contents. DocumentBodyNode can be associated with a DocumentRootNode by adding it to the collection of the DocumentRootNode.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.DocumentRootNode.Lists
member.summary: A collection of RichTextList objects where each RichTextList object identifies bulleted or numbered list in the document.

remarks.para: To create a bulleted or numbered list, create a object and add it to this collection. Create and add in the document a paragraph for each item in the list and set each paragraph's property to the same value as the RichTextList's . To create a hierarchical list, set the property of paragraphs appropriately - where 0 is the root level, 1 is the child level and so on.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.DocumentRootNode.AddListInfoListenerHelper(System.String,Infragistics.Documents.RichText.NodeBase)
member.summary: Used by the ParagraphNode to listen for changes to a RichTextList by its list info id. When the RichTextList with the specified id is added, replaced, removed or modified, the listener will be notified. The listener will also be notified when the list info collection is changed to different one on the root node.
member.param: List id.
Listener node.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.DocumentRootNode.AddStyleListenerHelper(System.String,Infragistics.Documents.RichText.NodeBase,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Used by the nodes to listen for changes to a style by its style id. When the style with the specified id is added, replaced, removed or modified, the listener will be notified. The listener will also be notified when the style collection is changed to different one on the root node.
member.param: Style id.
Listener node.
If styleId is null then this parameter specifies that changes in the default style is to be listened for.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.HyperlinkNode.SetStyleIdOnRuns(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the specified style id on all the runs in the hyper link.
member.param: Id of a character style that is in the root node's collection. If such a style does not exist then StyleId property will still be set on runs however it will be ignored (ineffective) until such a style is added to the root node's styles collection.
Indicates whether to set the to null on all runs.

remarks.para: By default runs that are made part of a hyperlink node as a result of method or various API's of , such as , have their set to "Hyperlink" id which refers to a character style that renders the text in the runs to have a hyperlink look (color and underline). However if you are manually populating runs of a hyperlink node then you may want to set their StyleId to an appropriate character style id to have the hyperlink be rendered as such or use this method to do so or change it afterwards.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.HyperlinkNode.SetText(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the text of the hyperlink node.
member.param: New text of the hyperlink.

remarks.para: SetText method removes existing content of the hyperlink node and sets the specified text as the new content. Note that if the hyperlink already has runs, the last run will be used for the new text. This is done to retain the character settings that the last run may have been using.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.ImageNode.RenderEffectsMargin
member.summary: Indicates the additional extent required by render effects, such as shadows, around the image.
member.remarks: RenderEffectsMargin added to the determine the final size occupied by this image in the document.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.ImageNode.RenderSize
member.summary: Indicates the render size of the image, excluding any render effects such as shadows.

remarks.para: RenderSize specifies the render size of the image, excluding any render effects such as shadows. If this property is not set then the value for it will be calculated automatically from the image.

If either the width or height of the RenderSize is set to a negative value then once the image is available (e.g. after it has been loaded) then the negative dimension will be calculated using the other (non-negative) dimension and the actual size of the image such that the image's aspect ratio is maintained. This calculated size will be returned by the property. In this scenario, the RenderSizeResolved property will return null until the image has been loaded.

For example, if the image is 200 pixels wide by 300 pixels high and the RenderSize is set with a width of 100 and a height of -1 then the property will return a width of 100 pixels and a height of 150 pixels once the image is loaded.

Note: Some serializers may chose to ignore a RenderSize that has a negative width or height if the image hasn't been loaded yet. Both the supplied RTF and Word serializers fall into this category because those formats don't support specifying only one dimension. Therefore, if one of those serializers is used to serialize the document before the image is available, i.e. it hasn't finished loading yet, then the aspect ratio can not be maintained and the RenderSize setting is ignored. The Html serializer is currently the only one that can deal with this because the html format supports specifying either a width or height attribute on an 'img' element.

member.exception: If both the width and height are negative.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.ImageNode.RenderSizeResolved
member.summary: Returns the render size of the image, excluding any render effects such as shadows (read-only).

remarks.para: If either the width or height of the property is set to a negative value then once the image is available (e.g. after it has been loaded) then the negative dimension will be calculated using the other (non-negative) dimension and the actual size of the image such that the image's aspect ratio is maintained. This calculated size will be returned by the RenderSizeResolved property. In this scenario, the RenderSizeResolved property will return null until the image has been loaded.

For example, if the image is 200 pixels wide by 300 pixels high and the RenderSize is set with a width of 100 and a height of -1 then the RenderSizeResolved property will return a width of 100 pixels and a height of 150 pixels once the image is loaded.

Note: Some serializers may chose to ignore a RenderSize that has a negative width or height if the image hasn't been loaded yet. Both the supplied RTF and Word serializers fall into this category because those formats don't support specifying only one dimension. Therefore, if one of those serializers is used to serialize the document before the image is available, i.e. it hasn't finished loading yet, then the aspect ratio can not be maintained and the RenderSize setting is ignored. The Html serializer is currently the only one that can deal with this because the html format supports specifying either a width or height attribute on an 'img' element.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.TableNode.CreateNewRow(System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new row with cells.
member.param: If >= zero will use the existing row at that index as a template creating corresponding cells for each of its cells and cloning each cell's settings.

Column's zero-based index.
member.returns: TableCellNode object or null if no such row or cell exists.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.TableNode.GetCellsInColumn(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets cells in a column.
member.param: Column's zero-based index.
Whether to include merged cells that span across this column. Note that any merged cell that begins at this column will always be included regardless of this parameter's value.
member.returns: Cells in the specified column.

remarks.para: If the specified column does not exist then this method returns an empty enumerable. The method does not raise an exception in such a case.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.TableNode.GetCellsInColumns(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets the cells in the specified columns.
member.param: Start column's zero-based index.
Number of columns.

Whether to include merged cells that span across the specified columns. Note that any merged cell that begins at one of the columns in the column range will always be included regardless of this parameter's value.
member.returns: Cells in the specified columns.

remarks.para: If the number of columns in the table are less than specified by the and the parameters then this method returns cells in columns that do exist in the range indicated by the parameters. The method does not raise an exception in such a case.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.TableNode.GetCellsInRow(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets cells in a row.
member.param: Row's zero-based index.
Whether to include merged cells that span across this row. Note that any merged cell that begins at this row will always be included regardless of this parameter's value.
member.returns: Cells in the row.

remarks.para: If the specified row does not exist then this method returns an empty enumerable. The method does not raise an exception in such a case.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.TableNode.GetCellsInRows(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets cells in the specified rows.
member.param: Row's zero-based index.
Number of rows starting from .
Whether to include merged cells that span across this row. Note that any merged cell that begins at this row will always be included regardless of this parameter's value.

remarks.para: If the number of rows in the table are less than specified by the and the parameters then this method returns cells in rows that do exist in the range indicated by the parameters. The method does not raise an exception in such a case.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.RectOffsets
member.summary: Used to specify portion of a source rectangle in terms of percentage of width and height of the source rectangle.

remarks.para: RectOffsets structure represents a relative portion of a source rectangle in terms of offsets from each edge of the source rectangle. Each offset is specified in terms of percentage of width or height of the source rectangle. For example, given a source rectangle of with x,y of 0,0 and width,height of 200,200 - RectOffsets with Left,Top,Right,Bottom values of 5,10,20,30 would result in the rectangle with x,y of 10,20 and width,height of 150,120.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.RectOffsets.Left
member.summary: Specifies the offset from the left edge of a source rectangle in terms of percentage of the width of the source rectangle.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.RectOffsets.Right
member.summary: Specifies the offset from the right edge of a source rectangle in terms of percentage of the width of the source rectangle.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.RectOffsets.Top
member.summary: Specifies the offset from the top edge of a source rectangle in terms of percentage of the height of the source rectangle.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.RectOffsets.Bottom
member.summary: Specifies the offset from the bottom edge of a source rectangle in terms of percentage of the height of the source rectangle.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.RichTextDocumentVersion.IsCompatibleWith(Infragistics.Documents.RichText.RichTextDocumentVersion)
member.summary: Determines if 2 RichTextDocumentVersion's are compatible. When the document's root or body node is changed (which happens when a document is loaded as well), the document's version is made incompatible with previous version objects. Also versions from two different instances are considered incompatible.
member.param: The document version to check for compatibility.

remarks.para: Note: if versions are not compatible then 's and 's can not be translated between them. Calling either or with an incompatible instancce will raise an exception.

member.returns: True if the specified version is compatible with this one, otherwise false.

member.summary: Specifies the id of the list. Id is case sensitive.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.RichTextList.LevelOverrides
member.summary: Specifies settings for one or more levels to use in place of settings specified by the or the ListStyle referred to by property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.RichTextList.ListStyleId
member.summary: Specifies the id of a that contains the list settings, such as whether the list is bulleted or numbered.
member.remarks: To specify settings that describe the style of list items, whether the items are bulleted, numbered or have custom text, set the property to an instance of . Alternatively you can also create a with its set and add it to collection and set ListStyleId property to the style's id. Note that ListStyleId and Template properties are exclusive. Specifying Template will cause the ListStyleId to be ignored.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.RichTextList.Template
member.summary: Specifies the list template to use for this list. contains the list settings, such as whether the list is bulleted or numbered.

remarks.para: Template property is used to specify a object that contains list settings, such as whether the list is bulleted or numbered. You can specifiy one of or Template but not both. If both are specified then ListStyleId will be ignored and information from the Template will be used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.ListTemplate.ListType

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.ListTemplate.CalculateSharedNumbers(Infragistics.Documents.RichText.RichTextListCollection)
member.summary: If a list template is used by multiple rich text lists, the numbers need to be contiguous across paragraphs of all the rich text lists that use that template. This is MS Word behavior. This method calculates numbers of all the paragraphs belonging to all the rich text lists that belong to the specified owning collection. It does NOT calculate numbers for all the rich text lists that belong to the specifed owningColleciton, just the lists in the owningCollection that use this template.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.RichTextScriptCodeMappings.Add(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a mapping from an ISO 15924 four-letter script code to a font names, replacing any existing mapping for the script code.

remarks.p: Note: The Common script code (Zyyy) cannot be mapped because MS Word and the RichTextDocument use the Latin script code (Latn) when getting fonts for characters with a Common script code.

member.param: The four-letter ISO 15924 script code.
The font name to use for characters from the specified script code.
member.exception: Occurs when is null.
Occurs when is null.
Occurs when is the Common script code (Zyyy).

member.summary: Removes a mapping from an ISO 15924 four-letter script code to a font names.

member.exception: Occurs when is null.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.ListLevelDefinition
member.summary: Settings that relate to a specific indentation level in a list of paragraphs.

remarks.para: ListLevelDefinition is used to specify various settings such as the list indicator to use, its appearance, indentation of the items etc... for items at a specific level in a list.
The following properties are required for a properly functioning list:

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.ListLevelDefinition.Level
member.summary: Gets/sets the 0-based level number. Valid range is from 0 to 8 inclusive.

remarks.para: Level property specifies the nesting level of the level definition. Valid range of values are 0 to 8, allowing for maximum of 9 nested levels in a list.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.ListLevelDefinition.LevelText
member.summary: Gets/sets the text content displayed at this level.

remarks.para: Note: There can be substitution strings within LevelText, if there is a '%' followed a number then the number will be interpreted as a 1-based level number and that level's text will be used in the text displayed to the user. Also be aware that level numbers higher than this level will be substituted with a null string.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.ListLevelDefinition.NumberAlignment
member.summary: Gets/sets the alignment for the number for this level.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.ListLevelDefinition.NumberFormat
member.summary: Gets/sets the format of the number

remarks.para: Note: if is set to true then this setting is ignored.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.ListLevelDefinition.NumberSettings
member.summary: Gets/sets the character settings to use for the number

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.ListLevelDefinition.NumberSuffix
member.summary: Gets/sets what to append to the number symbol, the default is 'Tab'.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.ListLevelDefinition.ParagraphSettings
member.summary: Gets/sets the settings to use for a paragraph at this level

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.ListLevelDefinition.ParagraphStyleId
member.summary: Gets/sets the id of the paragraph style to use for this level

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.ListLevelDefinition.RestartAtLevel
member.summary: Gets/sets the 0-based level to restart numbering at this level.

remarks.para: Note: if this is set to -1 or a value equal or greater than this level number then the numbering at this level will never automatically restart.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.ListLevelDefinition.Start
member.summary: Gets/sets the first number in the series, if not specified the default is 1.

remarks.para: Note: if this is set to negative value then the setting is ignored and the property will return null.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.ListLevelDefinition.UseLegalNumberFormat
member.summary: Determines whether to ignore number formatting and instead use list item number without any formatting.

remarks.para: UseLegalNumberFormat is used to display list item numbers in legal format, which is essentially item numbers from ancestor levels and current level combined using '.' separator. Legal number format is achieved by setting the to "%1.%2.%3...%n." where 'n' is the level number of the level definition where legal format is desired. Without setting UseLegalNumberFormat, this value of LevelText results in item numbers from ancestor levels and current level combined using '.' separator, including any formatting that the ancestor levels may have applied to their item numbers. So if an ancestor level had its own number formatting applied, then that formatted value would be used for that level. Setting UseLegalNumberFormat to true results in the number formatting to be ignored at all levels in the replacement LevelText value.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.ListLevelDefinition.ParagraphSettingsAllocated
member.summary: Gets the ParagraphSettings object. If it's not set then sets it to a new instance and returns the new instance.

member.summary: Gets/sets the margins around the cell

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.TableCellSettingsBase.Shading
member.summary: Gets/sets the shading for the background of the cell

remarks.para:
Note: a type converter is supplied to allow this structure to be specified in xaml. Here are some sample values, in quotes, along with corresponding c# code examples:
"automatic" - new Shading(ColorInfo.Automatic)
"#FF0000FF" - new Shading(new ColorInfo(Colors.Blue))
"#FF0000FF,-0.6" - new Shading(new ColorInfo(Colors.Blue, -.6d))
"DiagStripe:automatic" - new Shading(ColorInfo.Automatic, ShadingPattern.DiagStripe, null)
"Pct35:#FF0000FF,0.3" - new Shading(new ColorInfo(Colors.Blue, .3d), ShadingPattern.Pct35, null)
"Pct35:#FF0000FF,0.3:#FFFF0000" - new Shading(new ColorInfo(Colors.Blue, .3d), ShadingPattern.Pct35, new ColorInfo(Colors.Red))
"Pct35:#FF0000FF,0.3:#FFFF0000,-0.5" - new Shading(new ColorInfo(Colors.Blue, .3d), ShadingPattern.Pct35, new ColorInfo(Colors.Red, -.5d))

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.NodeUtils.Split(Infragistics.Documents.RichText.RunNode,Infragistics.Documents.RichText.DocumentSpan,Infragistics.Documents.RichText.RunNode@,Infragistics.Documents.RichText.RunNode@)
member.summary: Splits the run into two or three nodes. If specified span encompasses the entire run then returns false and does nothing. Otherwise if the span starts or ends the run node then the node is split into two where 'middle' is assigned to the new node and right is set to null. If the span is in the middle of the run then the run is split in three. Note that the middle and the right nodes will not be added to the run's parent node's child collection so they will be out of the document tree.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.NodeUtils.Split(Infragistics.Documents.RichText.RunNode,System.Int32,Infragistics.Documents.RichText.RunNode@)
member.summary: Splits the specified run node at the specified relativeOffset into two run nodes. After the split, the offset will be part of the right node. Note that the right node will not be added to the run's parent node's child collection so it will be out of the document tree.
member.param: Node to split.
Offset at which to split. After the split the offset will be contained by the 'right' node.
The new node that contains content after the specified offset, including the content at the offset itself.
member.returns: Returns true if the split was successful. False if the offset is out of range or belongs to the run itself or it can't be split.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.NodeUtils.Split(Infragistics.Documents.RichText.RunNode,Infragistics.Documents.RichText.NodeBase,Infragistics.Documents.RichText.RunNode@)
member.summary: Splits the specified run node at the specified 'childNode' into two run nodes. After the split, the childNode will be part of the right node. Note that the right node will not be added to the run's parent node's child collection so it will be out of the document tree.
member.param: Node to split.
Child node at which to split the run. After the split the childNode will be contained by the 'right' node.

The new node that contains content after the specified offset, including the content at the offset itself. This node will be out of the tree so you need to add it to the parent node's child collection at the right location.
member.returns: Returns true if the split was successful. False if the childNode is not a child of the run or the run can't be split.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.NodeUtils.Split(Infragistics.Documents.RichText.TextNode,System.Int32,Infragistics.Documents.RichText.TextNode@)
member.summary: Splits the text node at the offset. If the offset is at the start or end of the textNode then does nothing. When split occurs, the right will be assigned to the split instance however it will not be added to the tree.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.NodeUtils.SplitAndInsert``1(``0,System.Int32,``0)
member.summary: Splits the specified at the relativeOffset and inserts the specified so that it begins at the relativeOffset after the operation is complete. If the relativeOffset is at the beginning of at the end of the 'node' then the node is not split however the 'siblingToInsert' is inserted before or after the node depending upon whether the relativeOffset is at the beginning of the node or at the end of the node respectively.
member.param: Node to split.
Offset relative to the node.
Node to insert.
member.returns: True if the operation is successful. If relativeOffset is invalid then returns false.

Offset relative to the node.
Nodes to insert.
member.returns: True if the operation is successful. If relativeOffset is invalid then returns false.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.NodeUtils.SplitHelper(Infragistics.Documents.RichText.RunNode,Infragistics.Documents.RichText.DocumentSpan)
member.summary: Splits the run if necessary so that there is a run encompassed by the specified span. If the specified span encompasses the specified run entirely then does nothing and returns the run itself. Otherwise splits the run and returns the run that is encompassed by the span after the split, which can be the existing run or a new run. If a split is done then the the resultant nodes are added to the run's parent collection.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.InsertNodeRetrievalInfo._documentOffset
member.summary: Document offset at which the text is to be inserted.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.InsertNodeRetrievalInfo._nodeOffset
member.summary: This will be set to offset relative to the returned node where the insert is to take place in the returned node.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.InsertNodeRetrievalInfo._adjustedDocumentOffset
member.summary: If the insert location needs to be adjusted intelligently then this will be set to the adjusted value. It will always correspond to the parameters's new value except that this value is absolute (relative to the whole document) where as the offset is relative to the returned node.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.InsertNodeRetrievalInfo._changeTrackingDocumentOffset
member.summary: This will be set to the document offset for use for the purposes of offset change tracking. This will typically be the same as adjustedDocumentOffset except in cases where this method inserts some new content node and the text insertion happens at an offset after the start of the new inserted node. In such a case, from the point of view of the offset change tracking, the offset at which the insertion took place is this parameter's value, which would be start of the new node.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.InsertNodeRetrievalInfo._emulateTypingWithNoSelection
member.summary: Whether to emulate typing with while no selection in the editor.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.InsertNodeRetrievalInfo._addEmptyParagraphIfOffsetAfterDoc
member.summary: If the offset is equal to the document length then adds a new empty paragraph at the end of the body node and returns that.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.InsertNodeRetrievalInfo.SetOffsetsToAdjusted(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the _nodeOffset, _changeTrackingDocumentOffset and _adjustedDocumentOffset to the specified value.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.InsertTextOptions._mergeWithExistingSettings
member.summary: If true then existing character settings at the insert location are retained and any non-null values in _settings are applied to the inserted text. If false, the inserted text run will use _styleId and _settings.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.InsertTextOptions._cloneSettings
member.summary: This specifies that _settings is an external instance that was passed into an API and should not be owned. For example, InsertText method's settings parameter should be cloned before setting it on a run otherwise modifying the instance that was passed into the method will cause the run to be unexpectedly affected.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.InsertTextOptions.GetSettingsHelper
member.summary: This checks to see if _cloneSettings and if so clones the settings and returns the clone.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.ParagraphNode
member.summary: Represents a paragraph in the document.

remarks.para: A ParagraphNode represents a paragraph in the document. Paragraphs can be standalone in the document or nested within other content such as table cells for example. A ParagraphNode contains one or more objects. Each RunNode contains one or more objects, where each NodeText represents text.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.ParagraphNode.IsListItemResolved
member.summary: Indicates if the paragraph is part of a bulleted or numbered list.

remarks.para: To make a paragraph part of a list, set the property to id of a object in the 's collection. If the ListInfoId is specified but no RichTextList with such an id exists in the root node's Lists collection then this property returns false.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.ParagraphNode.MarkSettings
member.summary: Gets or sets a object that is used to control the appearance of list indicator (bullet or number) and paragraph symbol.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.ParagraphNode.ParagraphMarkSettingsResolved
member.summary: Gets a resolved object that is used to control the appearance of the paragraph mark.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.ParagraphNode.RunSettingsResolved
member.summary: Gets a resolved object that is used to control the default appearance of runs and marks in the paragraph.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.ParagraphNode.Settings
member.summary: Gets or sets a object used for specifying paragraph settings. Default value is null.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.ParagraphNode.SettingsResolved
member.summary: Gets a resolved object used for specifying paragraph settings.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.ParagraphNode.StyleId
member.summary: Gets or sets the id of paragraph style that is to be applied to the paragraph. Default value is null.

remarks.para: StyleId identifies the instance in the document root node's collection. If such a ParagraphStyle doesn't exist in the styles collection then this property is ignored.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.ParagraphNode.ListItemInfoResolved
member.summary: If this paragraph is part of a bulleted or numbered list then returns an instance of object that contains the list item information, such as the indicator for this item.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.ParagraphNode.ListId
member.summary: Gets the ListId property value of the settings if settings is non-null.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.ParagraphNode.ListLevel
member.summary: Gets the ListLevel property value of the settings if settings is non-null.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.ParagraphNode.SettingsAllocated
member.summary: Gets the Settings object. If it's not set then sets it to a new instance and returns the new instance.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.ParagraphNode.ApplySettings(Infragistics.Documents.RichText.ParagraphSettings)
member.summary: Applies any non-null settings in the specified object to this paragraph.
member.param: object that contains the settings to apply. Only properties of the object with non-null values will be applied.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.ParagraphNode.ClearContent
member.summary: Clears the paragraph content.

remarks.para: ClearContent method clears the content of the paragraph. It removes all but the last run node and clears the content of the last run node. This is done for the purposes of retaining any character settings that the run may be using so any new content inserted into the paragraph picks up that setting.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.ParagraphNode.GetText
member.summary: Gets the text in the paragraph.
member.returns: A string value that represents text in the paragraph.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.ParagraphNode.SetText(System.String)
member.summary: Clears the existing content of the paragraph and sets the new content to be the specified text.
member.param: New text of the paragraph.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.Selection.UpdateSelectionWithSpans(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Infragistics.Documents.RichText.DocumentSpan},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Allows one or more s to be applied to the selection as an atomic operation.
member.remarks:
Note that no change notifications are sent until all spans have been added at which point a single notification is sent.
Also, the start and end of the last provided span will be applied to the primary selection (i.e., the value returned by the property.
The provided spans will either be added to the currently selected ranges or entirely replace the currently selected ranges depending on the value supplied for the replaceEntireSelection paramater.
member.param: An IEnumerable of s that should be applied to the current selection.
True to replace the currently selected ranges or false to add the provided spans to the currently selected ranges.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.CharacterSettings.Shading
member.summary: Gets/sets the shading for the background.

remarks.para:
Note: a type converter is supplied to allow this structure to be specified in xaml. Here are some sample values, in quotes, along with corresponding c# code examples:
"automatic" - new Shading(ColorInfo.Automatic)
"#FF0000FF" - new Shading(new ColorInfo(Colors.Blue))
"#FF0000FF,-0.6" - new Shading(new ColorInfo(Colors.Blue, -.6d))
"DiagStripe:automatic" - new Shading(ColorInfo.Automatic, ShadingPattern.DiagStripe, null)
"Pct35:#FF0000FF,0.3" - new Shading(new ColorInfo(Colors.Blue, .3d), ShadingPattern.Pct35, null)
"Pct35:#FF0000FF,0.3:#FFFF0000" - new Shading(new ColorInfo(Colors.Blue, .3d), ShadingPattern.Pct35, new ColorInfo(Colors.Red))
"Pct35:#FF0000FF,0.3:#FFFF0000,-0.5" - new Shading(new ColorInfo(Colors.Blue, .3d), ShadingPattern.Pct35, new ColorInfo(Colors.Red, -.5d))

member.name: T:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.ParagraphIndentationSettings
member.summary: Settings that determine the indentation of a paragraph

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.ParagraphIndentationSettings.End
member.summary: Gets/sets the indent for lines in the paragraph from the right edge when the flow direction is left to right, otherwise the indent is from the left edge.

remarks.para:
Note: a type converter is supplied to allow this structure to be specified in xaml. Here are some sample values, in quotes, along with corresponding c# code examples:
"75%" - new Indentation(75)
"-75%" - new Indentation(-75)
".5in" - new Indentation(new Extent(.5, ExtentUnitType.Inches))

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.ParagraphIndentationSettings.FirstLine
member.summary: Gets/sets the indent for the first line in the paragraph from the left edge of the paragraph when the flow direction is left to right, otherwise the indent is from the right edge of the paragraph.

remarks.para:
Note: a type converter is supplied to allow this structure to be specified in xaml. Here are some sample values, in quotes, along with corresponding c# code examples:
"75%" - new FirstLineIndentation(new Indentation(75), false)
"-75%" - new FirstLineIndentation(new Indentation(-75), false)
"25.5px" - new FirstLineIndentation(new Indentation(new Extent(25.5, ExtentUnitType.LogicalPixels)), false)
"75% hanging" - new FirstLineIndentation(new Indentation(75), true)
"-75% hanging" - new FirstLineIndentation(new Indentation(-75), true)
".5in hanging" - new FirstLineIndentation(new Indentation(new Extent(.5, ExtentUnitType.Inches)), true)

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.ParagraphIndentationSettings.Start
member.summary: Gets/sets the indent for lines in the paragraph from the left edge when the flow direction is left to right, otherwise the indent is from the right edge.

remarks.para:
Note: a type converter is supplied to allow this structure to be specified in xaml. Here are some sample values, in quotes, along with corresponding c# code examples:
"75%" - new Indentation(75)
"-75%" - new Indentation(-75)
".5in" - new Indentation(new Extent(.5, ExtentUnitType.Inches))

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.ParagraphSettings.Indentation
member.summary: Get/sets the indentation of the lines within the paragraph.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.ParagraphSettings.ListId
member.summary: Specifies the list id associated with bulleted or numbered item this paragraph represents.

remarks.para: To create a bulleted or numbered list, create a object and add it to the document's root node's collection. Create a paragraph for each item in the list and set each paragraph's ListInfoId property to a string value that identifies the object added to the root node's Lists collection. To create a hierarchical list, set the property of paragraphs in the list appropriately - where 0 is the root level, 1 is the child level and so on.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.ParagraphSettings.ListLevel
member.summary: Specifies the 0-based level of the item in the bulleted or numbered list that this paragraph represents. Default value is -1, which is resolved to 0.

remarks.para: ListLevel property controls the level at which the paragraph appears in the bulleted or numbered list. The values are 0-based where the left-most level is 0 level. To control the appearance and formatting of the bullets or numbers, set the associated (association is made via the property) 's to refer to a in the root node's collection that provides bullets and/or numbers with desired formats. You can either create a custom or use one of the built-in styles exposed via the . If you do use on the the built-in style id's, make sure to add the built-in ListStyle to the root node's Styles collection.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.ParagraphSettings.MirrorIndents

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.ParagraphSettings.Shading
member.summary: Gets/sets the background shading for the paragraph

remarks.para:
Note: a type converter is supplied to allow this structure to be specified in xaml. Here are some sample values, in quotes, along with corresponding c# code examples:
"automatic" - new Shading(ColorInfo.Automatic)
"#FF0000FF" - new Shading(new ColorInfo(Colors.Blue))
"#FF0000FF,-0.6" - new Shading(new ColorInfo(Colors.Blue, -.6d))
"DiagStripe:automatic" - new Shading(ColorInfo.Automatic, ShadingPattern.DiagStripe, null)
"Pct35:#FF0000FF,0.3" - new Shading(new ColorInfo(Colors.Blue, .3d), ShadingPattern.Pct35, null)
"Pct35:#FF0000FF,0.3:#FFFF0000" - new Shading(new ColorInfo(Colors.Blue, .3d), ShadingPattern.Pct35, new ColorInfo(Colors.Red))
"Pct35:#FF0000FF,0.3:#FFFF0000,-0.5" - new Shading(new ColorInfo(Colors.Blue, .3d), ShadingPattern.Pct35, new ColorInfo(Colors.Red, -.5d))

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.TableCellSettings.PreferredWidth
member.summary: Gets/sets the preferred width of the cell

remarks.para: For this property, if the is 'Percent' it is a % of the overall width of the table. In this case, if the table’s preferred width is auto, the size of the table will be calculated based on the relative % values of each cell column coupled with each cell’s minimum width constraint (based on its content). Also note that the aggregate percentage value for all the columns’ preferred widths does not have to add up to 100%. These % values are treated more like relative weighting values. In other words in a 3 column table % values of 1-2-1 would result in the same layout as % values of 25-50-25 or 40-80-40 etc.

Note: the of TableRowSettings.LeadingEmptyAreaPreferredWidth and TableRowSettings.TrailingEmptyAreaPreferredWidth must be consistent for all s in the table and well as the UnitType of .. for all cells in the table. For example, if any of the unit types are set to 'Percent' they all must be set to 'Percent' or 'Auto'. Likewise, if they are set to 'Twip' they all must be set to 'Twip' or 'Auto'. If 'Percent' and 'Twip' settings are mixed then the first one encountered will take precedence and be used for all.

Note: a type converter is supplied to allow this structure to be specified in xaml. Here are some sample values, in quotes, along with corresponding c# code examples:
"none" - new TableExtent(0d, TableExtentUnitType.None)
"auto" - new TableExtent(0d, TableExtentUnitType.Auto)
"2 auto" - new TableExtent(0d, TableExtentUnitType.Auto)
"25.8" - new TableExtent(25.8d, TableExtentUnitType.Twip)
"53.8%" - new TableExtent(53.8d, TableExtentUnitType.Percent)

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.TableCellSettings.VerticalMerge
member.summary: Gets/sets the if and how this cell merges with the cell above or below it.

"12.5" - new TableRowHeight(new Extent(12.5, ExtentUnitType.Points), ExtentRule.Exact)
"20.5px" - new TableRowHeight(new Extent(20.5, ExtentUnitType.LogicalPixels), ExtentRule.Exact)
"atleast 12.5pt" - new TableRowHeight(new Extent(12.5, ExtentUnitType.Points), ExtentRule.AtLeast)
"atleast 20.5px" - new TableRowHeight(new Extent(20.5, ExtentUnitType.LogicalPixels), ExtentRule.AtLeast)

member.name: P:Infragistics.Documents.RichText.TableRowSettings.LeadingEmptyAreaPreferredWidth
member.summary: The preferred total width of the empty cells in this row before its first cell. This is ignored if is null or 0.

remarks.para: Note: the of TableRowSettings.LeadingEmptyAreaPreferredWidth and TableRowSettings.TrailingEmptyAreaPreferredWidth must be consistent for all s in the table and well as the UnitType of .. for all cells in the table. For example, if any of the unit types are set to 'Percent' they all must be set to 'Percent' or 'Auto'. Likewise, if they are set to 'Twip' they all must be set to 'Twip' or 'Auto'. If 'Percent' and 'Twip' settings are mixed then the first one encountered will take precedence and be used for all.

Note: a type converter is supplied to allow this structure to be specified in xaml. Here are some sample values, in quotes, along with corresponding c# code examples:
"none" - new TableExtent(0d, TableExtentUnitType.None)
"auto" - new TableExtent(0d, TableExtentUnitType.Auto)

"25.8" - new TableExtent(25.8d, TableExtentUnitType.Twip)
"53.8%" - new TableExtent(53.8d, TableExtentUnitType.Percent)

For example, if any of the unit types are set to 'Percent' they all must be set to 'Percent' or 'Auto'. Likewise, if they are set to 'Twip' they all must be set to 'Twip' or 'Auto'. If 'Percent' and 'Twip' settings are mixed then the first one encountered will take precedence and be used for all.

Note: a type converter is supplied to allow this structure to be specified in xaml. Here are some sample values, in quotes, along with corresponding c# code examples:

"auto" - new TableExtent(0d, TableExtentUnitType.Auto)

"25.8" - new TableExtent(25.8d, TableExtentUnitType.Twip)
"53.8%" - new TableExtent(53.8d, TableExtentUnitType.Percent)

member.summary: New text that the original text was replaced with.

remarks.para: ReplacementText indicates the new text that replaced the original text.

Note that ReplacementText and are exclusive. Only one of these properties will return a non-null value. Which one depends on the originating replacement operation that was performed on the RichTextDocument - call will result in ReplacementText returning the value and call will result in ReplacementContent returning the value.

member.name: F:Infragistics.StoragePropsInfo.PropInfo._updateDataItemAsynchronously
member.summary: Indicates whether to update the underlyin data item field asynchronously.

member.name: F:Infragistics.StoragePropsInfo.PropInfo._cacheDataItemConvertedValue
member.summary: Indicates whether to cache converted value for the property. When the property has a _converter, by default getting the value from underlying storage that's mapped to a data item will cause the field value to be retrieved from the data item and converted every time the store value is accessed. This indicates that the store should cache the value so the _converter is not used at every retrieval.
Constructor.
member.param: Property key.
Property name.
Property type.
Either a single field or IEnumerable of fields to which this property is mapped. For example, it can be a AppointmentProperty instance or IEnumerable<AppointmentProperty>.
Whether the property is read-only.
Converter that should be used to convert data source value to the value of the property and other way around as well.
Specifies if and how the value of the property will be copied when item is cloned.
If specified, it's used to initialize the default value of the property.
Specifies the default value of the property.
Used for comparing values.

Indicates whether the data item should be update asynchronously when the property's value changes. Typically used for complex objects where multiple synchronous modifications to the object are possible where it would undesirable to update the data item at every modification.
Indicates whether to cache the converted value - the value retrieved from underlying data item that is converted using a converter.
